message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.LG, cs.CL. 

The paper proposes a method for cross-modal similarity search in multimedia applications, which involves techniques from information retrieval (IR), computer vision (CV), multimedia (MM), machine learning (LG), and natural language processing (CL). However, since the focus is on cross-modal hashing, which is a technique commonly used in computer vision and multimedia applications, cs.CV and cs.MM are the most likely sub-categories. The use of machine learning techniques to learn binary hash codes suggests cs.LG as a likely sub-category. Finally, the use of natural language processing techniques is not explicitly mentioned in the abstract, but it is possible that the method could be applied to text-based multimedia data, which would make cs.CL a possible sub-category as well.
